intro: Diplotaxis viminea var. balearica, commonly known as the Balearic ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity.
